physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Inappropriately suppressed ketone bodies and inappropriate glycemic response to glucagon consistent with hyperinsulinism.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At age 6, follow-up fasting test showed complete resolution of hyperinsulinism.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Hypoglycemic seizure with suppressed ketone production at 3 months.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At 42 months, the evaluation showed normal adaptation to fasting, with no further evidence of hyperinsulinism.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Hyperinsulinism requiring IV dextrose, with inappropriately suppressed ketones and an inappropriate glycemic response to glucagon.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: By age 6, although clinically improved, mildly elevated liver transaminases and mild hepatomegaly were still present.
